subject: You’ve been removed from the LCW Dropbox team
body:
Hi Jorgelina,
Your administrator has deleted your LCW Dropbox account. You will no longer have access to the account and any shared links you’ve created will be disabled. Your computer will no longer sync with website, other computers, or other devices.
Re-register email
Create a new account
FAQ
Why is this happening?
Because LCW has deleted your account. You will no longer have access to the account or any shared links you've created.
 
Where did my content go?
Your admin will decide where your content will go. You will lose access immediately or the admin may transfer your work files to another team member. 
Learn more
 
Where are my options?
Contact your administrator if you have any questions
Re-register or create a new account
Visit the 
Help Center
 to learn more about these changes and what your options are.

subject: Re: Diligent/LCW - CoC Quote Request - GXO URGENT
body:
Dustin. Can you chat today? I do not know how to answer this. I'm sorry, but I need your call.
LMK what time you are free. I am available from 12pm EST onward.
Thank you!
From:
 Elixir Multimedia Solutions <elixirmultimediasolutions@gmail.com>
Sent:
 Thursday, March 13, 2025 4:40 PM
To:
 Jorgelina Venturi <j.venturi@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>; Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>; Keri Luo <k.luo@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Diligent/LCW - CoC Quote Request - GXO URGENT
 
 
The rates I sent were just specific to myself, there is a standing hourly with Diligent they are used to still I believe. 
This product is called a Code of Conduct. Looking at the work order I see there are remarks made regarding edits to video work from Diligent's own library. See below. This is where you would ask them if you are wanting LCW to do the video editing customizations outlined here. If so, I can provide a quote. You just want to get clarification if they want LCW to do the videos, so that you bake that time into the quote.
In order to develop an English Code of Conduct for Diligent, we've found it can estimate between 10hrs-15hrs depending on their customization template, included in the files shared with us. It looks average length, but since they are going with a new design template, it remains at 12hrs for myself to build. If you look at the Languages section of the Work Order, this is where I quote implementing each translation into a module. It averages 1-2hrs per language, with some right-to-left languages requiring more adjustments and sometimes being 3hrs. 
You can use the numbers I sent for a quote but they won't need too much additional information other than turnaround time. I see that the client was frustrated so I offered the two turnaround times if it helps. They are familiar with the overall work process, but I'm more than happy to help mitigate some of those emails or hop on a call to talk workflow if it helps.
Let me know if you are looking for something different or need more responses for the client conversation.
Best,
Dustin

No problem. I was traveling yesterday for work.
 
I'm not sure if the video edits proposed in the WO are aimed at us doing the work or their in-house team. If we do it it may range from 3-5hrs for all video edits. One looks to include an audio change so that would be dependent on Diligent directing us towards their voice over talent or handing us an updated audio file.
ENG - 12hrs
Each language - 1.5hrs (16.5hrs Total)
28.5x $65/hr = $1,852.5 (1 week turnaround ENG + 1 week for languages)
28.5x $40/hr = $1,140 (2 week turnaround ENG + 1.5-2 week for languages)
 
Let me know which path to take if they go with it!
 
Best,
Dustin
 
 
 
We can do this one on a "Rush" turnaround to regain clients grace if you want.

body:
Hi. Has the client received a response yet?
From:
 Elixir Multimedia Solutions <elixirmultimediasolutions@gmail.com>

Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>; Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>; Keri Luo <k.luo@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Diligent/LCW - CoC Quote Request - GXO URGENT
 
 
The rates I sent were just specific to myself, there is a standing hourly with Diligent they are used to still I believe.
This product is called a Code of Conduct. Looking at the work order I see there are remarks made regarding edits to video work from Diligent's own library. See below. This is where you would ask them if you are wanting LCW to do the video editing customizations outlined here. If so, I can provide a quote. You just want to get clarification if they want LCW to do the videos, so that you bake that time into the quote.
In order to develop an English Code of Conduct for Diligent, we've found it can estimate between 10hrs-15hrs depending on their customization template, included in the files shared with us. It looks average length, but since they are going with a new design template, it remains at 12hrs for myself to build. If you look at the Languages section of the Work Order, this is where I quote implementing each translation into a module. It averages 1-2hrs per language, with some right-to-left languages requiring more adjustments and sometimes being 3hrs. 
You can use the numbers I sent for a quote but they won't need too much additional information other than turnaround time. I see that the client was frustrated so I offered the two turnaround times if it helps. They are familiar with the overall work process, but I'm more than happy to help mitigate some of those emails or hop on a call to talk workflow if it helps.
Let me know if you are looking for something different or need more responses for the client conversation.
Best,
Dustin

subject: Re: Invoice for February
body:
Hi Jorgelina and Catalina,
 
I hope you are well!
 
My invoice for February was paid today, however the amount is not correct. As you can see in the invoice attached, the amount should be 
USD144.81
 but the payment was only 
USD22.58
.
 
It was probably a confusion with my previous invoice, for December, that had exactly this amount (USD22.58). It seems that you paid the amount for the previous invoice, not the one that I've sent to you for February. So there's still a 
difference of USD122.23
. Could you please ask your accounting department to arrange the payment of this difference?
 
Thanks!
José

No problem. I was traveling yesterday for work.
 
I'm not sure if the video edits proposed in the WO are aimed at us doing the work or their in-house team. If we do it it may range from 3-5hrs for all video edits. One looks to include an audio change so that would be dependent on Diligent directing us towards their voice over talent or handing us an updated audio file.
ENG - 12hrs
Each language - 1.5hrs (16.5hrs Total)
28.5x $65/hr = $1,852.5 (1 week turnaround ENG + 1 week for languages)
28.5x $40/hr = $1,140 (2 week turnaround ENG + 1.5-2 week for languages)
 
Let me know which path to take if they go with it!
 
Best,
Dustin
 
 
 
We can do this one on a "Rush" turnaround to regain clients grace if you want.

>

Hello! On the Word from the client you have the details of the project.
It will tell you if it’s an update of a course or Translation from scratch (it has always been updates), which course, which changes (many times they send them in a pptx), into which languages and if they need video/subtitle.
Keri will cofirm the scope, give you the Word count for the estímate, eventually the text for Translation and will say if you already have those videos translated or if you will have to work on them as well.
If in doubt, yes, check with Dustin.
Best,
CDS

Subject: 
Re: Diligent/LCW - CoC Quote Request - GXO URGENT
No problem. I was traveling yesterday for work.
 
I'm not sure if the video edits proposed in the WO are aimed at us doing the work or their in-house team. If we do it it may range from 3-5hrs for all video edits. One looks to include an audio change so that would be dependent on Diligent directing us towards their voice over talent or handing us an updated audio file.
ENG - 12hrs
Each language - 1.5hrs (16.5hrs Total)
28.5x $65/hr = $1,852.5 (1 week turnaround ENG + 1 week for languages)
28.5x $40/hr = $1,140 (2 week turnaround ENG + 1.5-2 week for languages)
 
Let me know which path to take if they go with it!
 
Best,
Dustin
 
 
 
We can do this one on a "Rush" turnaround to regain clients grace if you want.

subject: Re: Ceci's Onboarding - Lina's situation
body:
Hi Jorgelina,
Thank you so much for all your help with Cecilia. I'm sorry it didn't work out, but I understand life happens.
I really appreciate you making the time to help.
I will be chatting with Cecilia tomorrow to make sure she has everything she needs. 
I'll also remove your access by end of day Friday.
I hope we cross paths again!
Best,
Nicole
From:
 Jorgelina Venturi <j.venturi@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 12, 2025 9:08 AM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>; Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Ceci's Onboarding - Lina's situation
 
 
Hi Nicole
I just wanted to update you that Ceci’s onboarding will be completed this week, and from then on, she’ll be handling things 
on her own.
Recap:
She already has access to Emails, Trados, and Dropbox. Scoro is still pending, and I’ve also requested Diligent to grant her access to their Secure File page.
We’ve covered almost everything that Cata walked me through, and Ceci has Lina’s onboarding document (created by Cata) as a reference. That said, both Cata and I are available to support her until she feels fully confident.
Between today and Friday, I’ll continue guiding her through the remaining tasks, assisting with incoming projects and deliveries, and ensuring she’s up to speed before she takes over completely.
I’ll do my best to provide Ceci with helpful responses. However, Catalina will remain her primary point of contact for any questions I can’t address.
As for me:
I
 won’t charge LCW for my time, as I feel bad about not being able to continue in the role due to NDAs. No need to process any payment for the transition time.
Please feel free to remove my access
es
 by Friday night.
For emails, I can set up an auto-reply directing people to Ceci, and I can monitor things a bit longer just in case. 
Just let me know your preference.
I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused—I would have loved to continue supporting LCW! Hopefully, there will be opportunities to collaborate in the future.
 
Let me know if you have any questions.
 
Jorgelina (Lina) Venturi
Translation Specialist
LCW

subject: FW: Diligent/LCW - CoC Quote Request - GXO
body:
Hi Dustin,
We’ve received a project from Diligent—a Code of Conduct (CoC)—and we need your help in determining what needs to be done.
I know Catalina sent this to you, but to be honest, I’m not entirely clear on the scope of the project. Since Diligent is requesting quick responses from us, could you please advise on the next steps? I’ve attached the document the client sent us for reference.
Thanks so much for your time! Let me know if you have any questions.
Best,
 
Jorgelina (Lina) Venturi
Translation Specialist
LCW
 
 
From: 
Catalina De Sanctis <catadesanctis@gmail.com>
Date: 
Tuesday, 11 March 2025 at 2:34
 
PM
To: 
Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>, Jorgelina Venturi <j.venturi@lcwmail.com>, Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
Re: Diligent/LCW - CoC Quote Request - GXO
Hello! On the Word from the client you have the details of the project.
It will tell you if it’s an update of a course or Translation from scratch (it has always been updates), which course, which changes (many times they send them in a pptx), into which languages and if they need video/subtitle.
Keri will cofirm the scope, give you the Word count for the estímate, eventually the text for Translation and will say if you already have those videos translated or if you will have to work on them as well.
If in doubt, yes, check with Dustin.
Best,
CDS

subject: RE: Diligent call today - update
body:
Perfect, Ill ask Jorgelina about things as I need a little bit more clarification on the process.
Thank you for sharing!
 
De:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Enviado el:
 martes, 11 de marzo de 2025 13:14
Para:
 Jorgelina Venturi <j.venturi@lcwmail.com>; Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Asunto:
 Diligent call today - update
 
Hi there!
 
Just an update on the call I had with Diligent today....
 
I updated them on current projects. They just sent an update to confirm the Delmonte project. Dustin is doing this, so I shared this email with Dustin (copied you) & asked him to complete this project right away (by end of day Friday).
 
Diligent mentioned that there have been slow downs in turnaround times (which I think is caused by Dustin not answering us quickly).
 
They also mentioned that some comments in Articulate have been missed. I also believe this was from some missed things by Dustin.
 
Dustin is aware of these issues.
That's why we are moving to Keri in hopes that she can do things quickly. 
 
Let's talk more about this on our call Thursday 
@Cecilia Mariotta
. I want to make sure you have everything you need & that we have a plan to fix these issues.
 
We will probably have to have a call with Keri as well - the 3 of us. I will set that up soon.
Thank you!

n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Diligent/LCW - CoC Quote Request - GXO
 
 
Hi Lina,
Honestly, I have no idea what the quote is. Usually, Dustin asked me to design a PPT template with the client’s branding for their review if it’s a new eLearning course, although they all seem to be based on a premade course. Once the client approved the PPT design, Dustin created the English course and then lets translators translate it into the required languages. After that, Dustin puts the different languages into Storyline.
 
That’s what I understand about the Diligent process. Hope that helps. 
 
~Keri

Subject:

Hi Keri,
We’ve received a project from Diligent—a Code of Conduct (CoC)—and we need your help with it.
Normally, Catalina would send this to Dustin, and he would provide details on what we have so far and what needs to be translated. In this case, you’ll find the client’s email below, along with my message to Catalina and Nicole, and Cata’s response. I’ve also attached the document the client sent us.
Since you, Cecilia, and I are all relatively new to these projects, the best approach is to be open about what we know and what we don’t. That way, we can handle this project as effectively as possible without needing to involve Dustin.
Thanks so much for your time! Let me know if you have any questions.
Best,
 
Jorgelina (Lina) Venturi
Translation Specialist
LCW

Subject: 
Re: Diligent/LCW - CoC Quote Request - GXO
Hello! On the Word from the client you have the details of the project.
It will tell you if it’s an update of a course or Translation from scratch (it has always been updates), which course, which changes (many times they send them in a pptx), into which languages and if they need video/subtitle.
Keri will cofirm the scope, give you the Word count for the estímate, eventually the text for Translation and will say if you already have those videos translated or if you will have to work on them as well.
If in doubt, yes, check with Dustin.
Best,
CDS

body:
Hello! On the Word from the client you have the details of the project.
It will tell you if it’s an update of a course or Translation from scratch (it has always been updates), which course, which changes (many times they send them in a pptx), into which languages and if they need video/subtitle.
Keri will cofirm the scope, give you the Word count for the estímate, eventually the text for Translation and will say if you already have those videos translated or if you will have to work on them as well.
If in doubt, yes, check with Dustin.
Best,
CDS

subject: Diligent call today - update
body:
Hi there!
Just an update on the call I had with Diligent today....
I updated them on current projects. They just sent an update to confirm the Delmonte project. Dustin is doing this, so I shared this email with Dustin (copied you) & asked him to complete this project right away (by end of day Friday).
Diligent mentioned that there have been slow downs in turnaround times (which I think is caused by Dustin not answering us quickly).
They also mentioned that some comments in Articulate have been missed. I also believe this was from some missed things by Dustin.
Dustin is aware of these issues.
That's why we are moving to Keri in hopes that she can do things quickly. 
Let's talk more about this on our call Thursday 
@Cecilia Mariotta
. I want to make sure you have everything you need & that we have a plan to fix these issues.
We will probably have to have a call with Keri as well - the 3 of us. I will set that up soon.
Thank you!

Hi Jacquie, 
 
Thank you for reaching out this this project. I have a few questions before we can quote this properly:
 
1.Could you confirm if the file 
“Call, Don’t Fall”
 needs to be translated into four languages (Spanish, Marshallese, Bosnian, and Togo) in a bilingual format, as shown in the example below?
EN
SP
Call, don’t fall
Llame, no se caiga
We value your privacy and your safety.
Valoramos su privacidad y su seguridad.
We are glad to assist you!
Con gusto le asistiremos.
2.
 
Could you clarify if the PDF 
COMQ
 is for reference only? If the final target files need to match the COMQ format, we would need the original graphic file for proper formatting.
3. Lastly, can you confirm if the Spanish text in the 
COMQ
 file is approved? If so, we will ensure consistency by following that version.
Looking forward to your confirmation. 
 
Thanks in advance!
Jorgelina (Lina) Venturi
Translation Specialist
LCW

Jacquie M. Brunssen <

>

>

Amy Hynds <

>, Eve Lederhouse <
Eve.Lederhouse@mercyoneiowa.org
>
Subject: 
IMPORTANT: Translation of Falls Prevention Posters
Hi, 
 
I am requesting to have the following signage with 1) English on one side and Spanish on the other side as well as the following: 
2) English on one side and Marshallese on the other side
3) English on one side and Bosnian on the other side
4) English on one side and Togo on the other side
 
These 4 other languages: Spanish, Marshallese, Bosnian, and Togo are throughout our MercyOne Iowa region. 
 
Might you let me know the next steps in the process, as we’d like to have this standard signage across MercyOne. 
 
Please include Amy Hynds in the communication and what is returned. 
 
Also might you let me know the estimated cost for this per language poster. 
 
Thanks
Jacquie 
 
Jacquie Brunssen, RN MSN CPHQ CPHRM 
MercyOne Vice President, Clinical Quality & Safety

(563) 589-8311

Jacquie.Brunssen@mercyhealth.com

subject: Diligent call tomorrow - URGENT
body:
Hi. I need to know if you (Cecilia) can make the Diligent call tomorrow at 11:30am-12pm ET. Can you please confirm? I'm not sure if you have gotten info about this call yet.
I cannot do this call alone, as I do not have enough info about what needs to be discussed.
Jorgelina - Can you help Cecilia & I get up to speed so we are prepared for this call?

Hi Jacquie, 
 
Thank you for reaching out this this project. I have a few questions before we can quote this properly:
 
1.Could you confirm if the file 
“Call, Don’t Fall”
 needs to be translated into four languages (Spanish, Marshallese, Bosnian, and Togo) in a bilingual format, as shown in the example below?
EN
SP
Call, don’t fall
Llame, no se caiga
We value your privacy and your safety.
Valoramos su privacidad y su seguridad.
We are glad to assist you!
Con gusto le asistiremos.
2.
 
Could you clarify if the PDF 
COMQ
 is for reference only? If the final target files need to match the COMQ format, we would need the original graphic file for proper formatting.
3. Lastly, can you confirm if the Spanish text in the 
COMQ
 file is approved? If so, we will ensure consistency by following that version.
Looking forward to your confirmation. 
 
Thanks in advance!
Jorgelina (Lina) Venturi
Translation Specialist
LCW

Subject: 
IMPORTANT: Translation of Falls Prevention Posters
Hi, 
 
I am requesting to have the following signage with 1) English on one side and Spanish on the other side as well as the following: 
2) English on one side and Marshallese on the other side
3) English on one side and Bosnian on the other side
4) English on one side and Togo on the other side
 
These 4 other languages: Spanish, Marshallese, Bosnian, and Togo are throughout our MercyOne Iowa region. 
 
Might you let me know the next steps in the process, as we’d like to have this standard signage across MercyOne. 
 
Please include Amy Hynds in the communication and what is returned. 
 
Also might you let me know the estimated cost for this per language poster. 
 
Thanks
Jacquie 
 
Jacquie Brunssen, RN MSN CPHQ CPHRM 
MercyOne Vice President, Clinical Quality & Safety

Hello Randi,
Thank you for your patience.
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

subject: Re: Diligent - WO_DELMONTE_COC_080624 - Del Monte CoC
body:
Hello Randi,
Thank you for your patience.
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.

3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.

Hi Catalina,
 
Ok, if any availability pops up today, please let me know and I will make that time work. But in the meantime, sent over an invite for Friday.
 
Here is a summary of the situation:
Del Monte noted earlier this week that the SCORM 2004 test file worked well in their LMS but followed up asking if we could send them their test report.
We informed them that without explicit access to their LMS and metadata, it would not be possible to generate a report on their behalf.
They replied that their LMS does not allow for any reports to be exported. This is where the misunderstanding occurred.
Earlier in the project, it was interpreted that they were not getting the desired information from SCORM 1.2 completion reports. That is why we decided to proceed with SCORM 2004 as it allows for customized reportage.
We have asked Del Monte to confirm with their LMS, Convercent, what type of reports or metadata can be generated or exported. Awaiting a response here.
Questions to discuss:
Is there any way to run a report on behalf of Del Monte?
Have reporting capabilities been brought up in the prior year updates for Del Monte? If so, what was the recommendation?
Thanks!
_________________________

Best,
Dustin

Del Monte has provided a response from their LMS. Please see below in 
blue
:
 
OData will present the score and if the employee fails, it will not show the course as complete on the employee's end. 
 
In the example below, you will see three "employees" who took the course. The two employees who passed show a score, whereas the employee who failed does not show a score in OData.
 
 
On the employee's end, this is what they will see.
 
 
Could this please be passed along to Dustin for review.
 
Thanks!

Subject:

Hi Catalina,
 
I shared the feedback and asked about better visibility on Convercent’s settings. I expect Del Monte to request for one more call with yourself, Dustin, and Convercent on the line to try to fine tune the details. Stay tuned for an update!
 
Thanks,
 
Don
 
 
From:
 Catalina De Sanctis <c.desanctis@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 25, 2025 6:17 AM
To:
 Randi Mooney <rmooney@diligent.com>
Cc:
 Brian Luong <bluong@diligent.com>; Don Reyes <dreyes@diligent.com>; Karen Lai <klai@diligent.com>; Kumud Mishra <kmishra@diligent.com>; Jorgelina Venturi <j.venturi@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Diligent - WO_DELMONTE_COC_080624 - Del Monte CoC
 
EXTERNAL:
 This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
 
Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

I just sent the question to Convercent but in the screenshot shared, it showed a score of 100 for completion and a blank score for incompletion, so I don't think it is pass/fail score? The issue we have is that we can't distinguish all blank scores that are incomplete, and we don't know if in fact they completed the course. We could even be ok with a blank score if the participant was able to complete the course.
 
Thanks,

The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.

subject: RE: Altera COC Update- Quote Request: WO_Altera_COC_121824
body:
Hi Nicole,
 
It seems like a comment on the Portuguese course was missed, so Altera has made a new comment for that slide in your updated link. There is also one more correction to the year on the language selection menu that needs to be made:
 
 
Once these comments have been updated, please proceed with publishing the wrapped SCORM. May I please request an ETA for this? There has been a few delays with this project, so if your team can provide the final deliverables ASAP that would be greatly appreciated.
 
 
Thank you,
Karen

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Hello Randi,
Yes this is ready!
Please check his comments below:
 
I updated the Del Monte course for them to test on their end. This method involves the least amount of scope increase since we're at the translation phase. See below for what I did to the package to relay to them. Then can use the Menu to skip to the Certification slide to test both clickable decisions.
 
 
On the screen below, when the learner selects the No, the course will complete when the final slide loads. If the learner selects Yes, then the course will register as incomplete when reaching the final slide. 
If this is not enough for them, please have Del Monte describe how they are going to mitigate this issue for themselves internally with the limitations of their LMS, and we can adjust the package accordingly. 
Since their LMS doesn't allow the reportage they want, they need to decide how they are going to reach out to people who appear incomplete if this isn't good enough. That may even need to include adding language to the course that would then need translation. Reconfiguration/Testing of the course for numerical scores to be sent to signal the selected response in question, would take 1hr per language to adjust totaling $1400 ($140*10lg) additional to the scope on my end. The adjustment I did here would only increase the scope between $140-$280 overall to apply the fix.
 
 
Please let us know your comments.
Thanks!
CDS
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

Hi Catalina,
 
Ok, if any availability pops up today, please let me know and I will make that time work. But in the meantime, sent over an invite for Friday.
 
Here is a summary of the situation:
Del Monte noted earlier this week that the SCORM 2004 test file worked well in their LMS but followed up asking if we could send them their test report.
We informed them that without explicit access to their LMS and metadata, it would not be possible to generate a report on their behalf.
They replied that their LMS does not allow for any reports to be exported. This is where the misunderstanding occurred.
Earlier in the project, it was interpreted that they were not getting the desired information from SCORM 1.2 completion reports. That is why we decided to proceed with SCORM 2004 as it allows for customized reportage.
We have asked Del Monte to confirm with their LMS, Convercent, what type of reports or metadata can be generated or exported. Awaiting a response here.
Questions to discuss:
Is there any way to run a report on behalf of Del Monte?
Have reporting capabilities been brought up in the prior year updates for Del Monte? If so, what was the recommendation?
Thanks!

:
 
OData will present the score and if the employee fails, it will not show the course as complete on the employee's end. 
 
In the example below, you will see three "employees" who took the course. The two employees who passed show a score, whereas the employee who failed does not show a score in OData.

Hey Catalina!
 
On this call with the client and Diligent it was a little awkward because their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
 
I'll keep a look out for Del Monte's response to turn another version around for them ASAP.
 
Best,
Dustin

Hello Dus,
Please check this.
 
Del Monte will be following up with their LMS on this matter. Also including another 
comment 
Del Monte provided below:
 
I just sent the question to Convercent but in the screenshot shared, it showed a score of 100 for completion and a blank score for incompletion, so I don't think it is pass/fail score? The issue we have is that we can't distinguish all blank scores that are incomplete, and we don't know if in fact they completed the course. We could even be ok with a blank score if the participant was able to complete the course.
 
 
Thanks!
CDS

Subject:
 Del monte course
 
I updated the Del Monte course for them to test on their end. This method involves the least amount of scope increase since we're at the translation phase. See below for what I did to the package to relay to them. Then can use the Menu to skip to the Certification slide to test both clickable decisions.
 
 
On the screen below, when the learner selects the No, the course will complete when the final slide loads. If the learner selects Yes, then the course will register as incomplete when reaching the final slide. 
If this is not enough for them, please have Del Monte describe how they are going to mitigate this issue for themselves internally with the limitations of their LMS, and we can adjust the package accordingly. 
Since their LMS doesn't allow the reportage they want, they need to decide how they are going to reach out to people who appear incomplete if this isn't good enough. That may even need to include adding language to the course that would then need translation. Reconfiguration/Testing of the course for numerical scores to be sent to signal the selected response in question, would take 1hr per language to adjust totaling $715 additional to the scope on my end. The adjustment I did here would only increase the scope between $65-$130 overall to apply the fix.
 
 
Let me know if you have any questions. 
 
Best,
Dustin

We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

subject: Re: Del monte course WO_DELMONTE_COC_080624
body:
Ok, so it appears they will need two passing grades. One that is 100% and one that is 80%. I will build this out today and get them something by early tomorrow at the latest after I test, even though the tests on my end are on a different LMS with more features.
Best,
Dustin 
On Fri, Feb 28, 2025 at 1:58 PM Jorgelina Venturi <
j.venturi@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hi Dustin,
 
Client just provided this information and asked them to pass it along to you. Can you check into this?
I will be OOO Monday and Tuesday, coming back on Wednesday, please feel free to reach out to Nicole if needed.
 
 
Hello,
 
Del Monte has provided a response from their LMS. Please see below in 
blue
:
 
OData will present the score and if the employee fails, it will not show the course as complete on the employee's end. 
 
In the example below, you will see three "employees" who took the course. The two employees who passed show a score, whereas the employee who failed does not show a score in OData.
 
 
On the employee's end, this is what they will see.
 
 
Could this please be passed along to Dustin for review.
 
Thanks!
 
 
 
Jorgelina (Lina) Venturi
Translation Specialist
LCW

Elixir Multimedia Solutions <

c.desanctis@lcwmail.com

Subject: 
Re: Del monte course WO_DELMONTE_COC_080624
Hey Catalina!
 
On this call with the client and Diligent it was a little awkward because their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
 
I'll keep a look out for Del Monte's response to turn another version around for them ASAP.
 
Best,
Dustin

comment 
Del Monte provided below:
 
I just sent the question to Convercent but in the screenshot shared, it showed a score of 100 for completion and a blank score for incompletion, so I don't think it is pass/fail score? The issue we have is that we can't distinguish all blank scores that are incomplete, and we don't know if in fact they completed the course. We could even be ok with a blank score if the participant was able to complete the course.
 
 
Thanks!
CDS

Hey Catalina!
 
With testing I have the result below when selecting "No, I have nothing to report".
 
If the user selects "Yes, I have something to report", then they will get a "50% score" and the course will show incomplete. This said, if the 50% score is achieved it shows the learner DID complete the course VS someone with no score and an incomplete. Just to help their reportage find the users they need to call out to more efficiently. 
 
The file is on the server for them now. 
 
Let me know if they need any other adjustments.
 
Best,
Dustin

Subject:
 Del monte course
 
I updated the Del Monte course for them to test on their end. This method involves the least amount of scope increase since we're at the translation phase. See below for what I did to the package to relay to them. Then can use the Menu to skip to the Certification slide to test both clickable decisions.
 
 
On the screen below, when the learner selects the No, the course will complete when the final slide loads. If the learner selects Yes, then the course will register as incomplete when reaching the final slide. 
If this is not enough for them, please have Del Monte describe how they are going to mitigate this issue for themselves internally with the limitations of their LMS, and we can adjust the package accordingly. 
Since their LMS doesn't allow the reportage they want, they need to decide how they are going to reach out to people who appear incomplete if this isn't good enough. That may even need to include adding language to the course that would then need translation. Reconfiguration/Testing of the course for numerical scores to be sent to signal the selected response in question, would take 1hr per language to adjust totaling $715 additional to the scope on my end. The adjustment I did here would only increase the scope between $65-$130 overall to apply the fix.
 
 
Let me know if you have any questions. 
 
Best,
Dustin

EN
SP
Call, don’t fall
Llame, no se caiga
We value your privacy and your safety.
Valoramos su privacidad y su seguridad.

COMQ

COMQ

Looking forward to your confirmation.

Hi Jacquie, 
 
Thank you for reaching out this this project. I have a few questions before we can quote this properly:
 
1.Could you confirm if the file 
“Call, Don’t Fall”
 needs to be translated into four languages (Spanish, Marshallese, Bosnian, and Togo) in a bilingual format, as shown in the example below?
EN
SP
Call, don’t fall
Llame, no se caiga
We value your privacy and your safety.
Valoramos su privacidad y su seguridad.
We are glad to assist you!
Con gusto le asistiremos.
2.
 
Could you clarify if the PDF 
COMQ
 is for reference only? If the final target files need to match the COMQ format, we would need the original graphic file for proper formatting.
3. Lastly, can you confirm if the Spanish text in the 
COMQ
 file is approved? If so, we will ensure consistency by following that version.
Looking forward to your confirmation. 
 
Thanks in advance!
Jorgelina (Lina) Venturi
Translation Specialist
LCW

“Call, Don’t Fall”
 needs to be translated into four languages (Spanish, Marshallese, Bosnian, and Togo) in a bilingual format, as shown in the example below?
EN
SP
Call, don’t fall
Llame, no se caiga
We value your privacy and your safety.
Valoramos su privacidad y su seguridad.
We are glad to assist you!
Con gusto le asistiremos.

COMQ

COMQ
 file is approved? If so, we will ensure consistency by following that version.
Looking forward to your confirmation. 
 
Thanks in advance!
Jorgelina (Lina) Venturi
Translation Specialist
LCW

body:
Hi Dustin,
 
Client just provided this information and asked them to pass it along to you. Can you check into this?
I will be OOO Monday and Tuesday, coming back on Wednesday, please feel free to reach out to Nicole if needed.
 
 
Hello,
 
Del Monte has provided a response from their LMS. Please see below in 
blue
:
 
OData will present the score and if the employee fails, it will not show the course as complete on the employee's end. 
 
In the example below, you will see three "employees" who took the course. The two employees who passed show a score, whereas the employee who failed does not show a score in OData.
 
 
On the employee's end, this is what they will see.
 
 
Could this please be passed along to Dustin for review.
 
Thanks!
 
 
 
Jorgelina (Lina) Venturi
Translation Specialist
LCW

Subject:

Hey Catalina!
 
On this call with the client and Diligent it was a little awkward because their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
 
I'll keep a look out for Del Monte's response to turn another version around for them ASAP.
 
Best,
Dustin

Subject:
 Del monte course
 
I updated the Del Monte course for them to test on their end. This method involves the least amount of scope increase since we're at the translation phase. See below for what I did to the package to relay to them. Then can use the Menu to skip to the Certification slide to test both clickable decisions.
 
 
On the screen below, when the learner selects the No, the course will complete when the final slide loads. If the learner selects Yes, then the course will register as incomplete when reaching the final slide. 
If this is not enough for them, please have Del Monte describe how they are going to mitigate this issue for themselves internally with the limitations of their LMS, and we can adjust the package accordingly. 
Since their LMS doesn't allow the reportage they want, they need to decide how they are going to reach out to people who appear incomplete if this isn't good enough. That may even need to include adding language to the course that would then need translation. Reconfiguration/Testing of the course for numerical scores to be sent to signal the selected response in question, would take 1hr per language to adjust totaling $715 additional to the scope on my end. The adjustment I did here would only increase the scope between $65-$130 overall to apply the fix.
 
 
Let me know if you have any questions. 
 
Best,
Dustin

Just to help their reportage find the users they need to call out to more efficiently. 
 
The file is on the server for them now. 
 
Let me know if they need any other adjustments.
Best,
CDS

Thanks!

Hi all,
 
While it's Larry's last day today, it's also Catalina's last day 
🙁
. I know everyone who has worked with Catalina knows how great she is. She will be sorely missed! 
 
The good news is that Catalina has helped us find her replacement - Jorgelina's (Lina). Lina is just as amazing as Catalina, and I know you will enjoy working with her. Lina has started, is based in Argentina, & will be training with Catalina to get up to speed. Lina will also be joining our all-staff meeting on Tuesday. Please reach out to her for a warm welcome! 
 
Welcome Lina!
 
 
Nicole Barile

Subject:
 Farewell Catalina & Welcome Jorgelina (Lina) - Translation Coordinator
 
Hi all,
 
While it's Larry's last day today, it's also Catalina's last day 
🙁
. I know everyone who has worked with Catalina knows how great she is. She will be sorely missed! 
 
The good news is that Catalina has helped us find her replacement - Jorgelina's (Lina). Lina is just as amazing as Catalina, and I know you will enjoy working with her. Lina has started, is based in Argentina, & will be training with Catalina to get up to speed. Lina will also be joining our all-staff meeting on Tuesday. Please reach out to her for a warm welcome! 
 
Welcome Lina!
 
 
Nicole Barile
